Then-Secretary of State Colin Powell afforded a clue when he said in May 2002, How important it was for me to have this unified body of opinion and thought behind me in working for peace. In other words, the President Bush administration formed the Quartet to insulate itself from blame for diplomatic failure and unilateralism. Tony Dungy said. Hear the entire interview in this CBS Philly SportsPod... Tony Dungy says he truly marveled over some of the things Michael Vick was able to do this season for the Eagles. He was calm in the pocket, he was hitting second, third, fourth receivers, throwing the ball well and just being in command of things. And then still with that ability to escape and get away from the rush and make plays out of nothing, Tony Dungy told KYW Newsradio. What we find is that once people see the phone, they fall in love with it.
